'The truth about Harvey Dent is simple in only one regard - it has been hidden for too long. After his devastating injuries, Harvey's mind has recovered no better than his mutilated face. He was a broken, dangerous man, not the crusader for justice that I, James Gordon, have portrayed him to be for the last eight years. Harvey's rage was indiscriminate. Psychopathic. If Commissioner Gordon thinks I'm the Batman he must be in a bad way  Why did you say your boys' home used to be funded by the Wayne Foundation?      You checked that name? 'Bane' -  Now Daggett's brought them here?  Why did the Wayne Foundation stop funding boys' homes in the city?  Time to talk to Mr. Fox, I think.  No. Do we still have any cars around the place?  And I need an appointment at the hospital. About my leg.  Whichever one Jim Gordon's in.            I see you haven't lost your sense of humor...even if you have lost most of my money.  Even with -  What're my options?  I can't, Lucius.  You too, Lucius?  I'll think it over.  No, why?  I retired.  I figured you'd have shut this place down.  But all this new stuff?  Why?  It's fine the use it gets these days.  Now you're just showing off.  What's it called?  What's wrong with that?  Better mind?  I told you. I retired, Lucius.  That's good -  The Batman wasn't needed anymore. We won.  What if he doesn't exist anymore?  I'm not sure if my assistant put me on the guest list -  Miss Tate, isn't it?  True. Proceeds go to the big fat spread, not the cause. It's not about charity, it's about feeding the ego of whichever society hag laid it on.  Oh.  That's very generous of you.  Sometimes the investment doesn't pay off. Sorry. 42.  Mind if I cut in?  You don't seem very happy to see me.  Felt like some fresh air.  I have a powerful friend who deals with this kind of thing. (Admires her cat ears.) Brazen costume for a cat burglar.  Bruce Wayne, eccentric billionaire. Who's your date?  It's pronounced 'Ibeetha'. You wouldn't want these folks realizing you're a crook not a social climber.  I doubt you care what anyone in this room thinks about you.  Well, Selina Kyle, I know you came here from your walk-up in Old Town - modest place for a master jewel thief. Which means either you're saving for your retirement - or you're in deep with the wrong people.  Actually, I was born in the Regency Room.  Start fresh.  Or our achievements.  You think that justifies stealing?  Robin Hood?  Maybe you're assuming too much.  Ouch.  Sounds like you're looking forward to it. 45.  These pearls do look better on you then they did in my safe... But I still can't let you keep them.  Not likely.  I must have lost my ticket -  My wife?  Remember those 'unusual requests' I used to make?  You start with the good limb so it learns your optimum muscle patterns. Now we tighten it up.     Not bad - Not bad at all.  I'm all ears.  Bane.  Born in a prison?  Bane was a member of the League of Shadows. 48.  I didn't realize I was known for trifling with criminals.  Which was?  If this man is all the things you say he is, then this city needs me.  I tried helping as Bruce Wayne, Alfred. And I failed.  That's what you're afraid of - that if I go back out there I'll fail.  We bought all the neighbors.   I retrieved this.  They don't have the tools to analyze it.  One man's tool is another man's weapon.  Alfred. Enough. The police weren't getting it done -  Perhaps you're upset you were wrong.  You thought I didn't have it in me.  I'll fight harder, I always have.  You said he was excommunicated.  R¯'s al Gh¯l was the League of  Trades of some kind. Coded... 66.  Mine. Courtesy of Selina Kyle. Get this to Fox - he can crack the code and tell us what trades they were executing.      You'd abandon me?  Rachel died knowing we'd decided to be together. That was my life beyond this cave and I can't just move on. She didn't. She couldn't.  She was, I can't change that -  Why would you say such a thing?  You're lying.  You're lying!  How dare you use Rachel to stop me!  Sorry?! You expect to destroy my world, then shake hands?!  What does it mean, Alfred?!  Goodbye, Alfred.           Alfred?        Yes. Could you decode the trades on that drive?     The weapons - we can't let Daggett get his hands on Applied Sciences -  Miranda Tate. We need to convince the board to get behind her. Let's show her the reactor -     I thought you might like to see what your investment built. 71.  If it worked. It doesn't.  Ignition, yes. But no chain reaction.  Miranda, if it were operational, the danger to Gotham would be too great.  Someone else will work out what Dr. Pavel did. Someone else will figure out how to turn this power source into a nuclear weapon. I need you to take control of Wayne Enterprises and this reactor.  Nothing. Until we can find a way to guarantee its safety. 72.  Decommission it. Flood it.  If the world's not ready. Yes.  I'm trusting you.  I could've flooded this chamber any time in the last three years. I'm choosing to trust you, Miranda, and that's not the easiest thing for me. Please.      I understand. Ladies and gentlemen.      To protect the people closest to me.  There are always people you care about. You just don't realize how much until they're gone. (Collects himself.) The idea was to be a symbol. Batman could be anybody, that was the point.  Not everybody agrees.  Got anything on Bane's whereabouts?      Don't wait. I'll get a cab. 77.   Actually, no.  I don't think so.  Actually, they're letting me keep the house.   Vacation?  My powerful friend hopes to change your mind about leaving.  By giving you what you want.  He says it does. He wants to meet. Tonight.  He needs to find Bane. He thinks you'd know how.  No, you're not.     No. I'm on my own now.  Never needed them...     Hope you don't like me for your money.  He left. Taking everything.      You're pretty good at that.  I assumed your family was wealthy.  I've made a few myself.  Someday perhaps. Not tonight.            Why didn't you just kill me?     Where am I?         Do it for the pleasure.  Has anyone made it?  What does he say?  Bane.  Don't.  How would he know?  How?  Is Bane the child you spoke of? Was he born here?  How -?  I watched you die.  You were the mercenary. Bane is your child. Your heir.  No...    I'm not meant to die in here. 118.  You told me a child did it...  My body makes the jump.  My soul's as ready to escape as my body.  I'm not afraid. I'm angry.  And why do we fall?  Why?  I do fear death. I fear dying in here while my city burns with no one there to save it.  How?  Pretty generous, for a thief. 133.  Not yet.  It wouldn't suit you. I need your help.  For this. The 'Clean Slate'.  I admit I felt a little let down. But I still think there's more to you. In fact, I think for you - this isn't a tool, it's an escape route. You want to disappear. Start fresh.  I can give you a way off. Once you've gotten me to Lucius Fox. I need you to find out where they're holding him. Then take me in.  To save this city. 134.  Maybe you do. But tomorrow that bomb's going off.  I'm trying. But I need Fox.  How long until the core ignites?  Unless we can connect it to the reactor.  Not tonight. I'm sorry.     To get me back in the game.  I won't forget about you.  Any move I make against Bane or the bomb - the triggerman sets it off.  Could you block it?  Even without the autopilot...
dialogues.Gordon: Harvey Dent was needed. He was everything Gotham has been crying out for. He was...a hero. Not the hero we deserved - the hero we needed. Nothing less than a knight, shining...  But I knew Harvey Dent. I was...his friend. And it will be a very long time before someone inspires us the way he did. I believed in Harvey Dent.  Congressman.  Maybe the truth about Harvey isn't so simple, Congressman.  The truth...? 10. I have written a speech telling the truth about Harvey Dent... Maybe the time isn't right...  Maybe right now all you need to know is that there are a thousand inmates in Blackgate Prison as a direct result of the Dent Act. These are violent criminals, essential cogs in the organized crime machine that terrorized Gotham for so long. Maybe, for now, all I should say about Harvey Dent's death is this...it has not been for nothing.  The second shift reports in?  That's your department.  What's the problem, son?  That's a job for the police?  Old habits. 17.  What's your name, son?  You have something you want to ask me, Officer Blake?  What about it?  I'm not hearing a question, son.  I know exactly who he was. (Turns to Blake.) He was Batman.  Let's go see about the Congressman's wife... 18.  Manhole!  You three, down with me. You two, head down to cover the next exit -  Get the DWP down here, now!  We were in this together. Then you were gone...  Built on a lie. Our lie. Now there's evil rising from where we tried to bury it. Nobody will listen... The Batman has to come back. 39.  He must. He must.  Why?     Get more men, work a grid. I want him found.  This is good work. Lose the uniform - you're working for me now. We could use some hotter heads around here. 80.  You're a detective now, son, you're not allowed to believe in coincidence anymore.  So you think our friend is gone again?  What's happened?  No more patrols, no more hide and seek. Send every available cop down there to smoke him out. 93.  Don't apologize for believing the world's in better shape then it is...just fight to make it true.  Not you. You're telling me the Batman's gone. So you chase up the Daggett leads, any way you can.  Anything strange about the pourings?  But you know about patterns. Keep looking.  Clear the corners, rookie.  Get my coat, son. 103.  It means we're on our own. I have to get in front of a camera -  The Mayor's dead. I'm the symbol of law and order. Bane says he's giving Gotham back to the people - they need to know that I could lead.  Then he'll show his true colors.  A lie to keep a city from burning to the ground. Gotham needed a hero, someone to believe in -   There's a point. Far out there. When the structures fail you. When the rules aren't weapons anymore, they're shackles, letting the bad get ahead. Maybe one day you'll have such a moment of crisis. And in that moment, I hope you have a friend like I did. To plunge their hands into the filth so you can keep yours clean.  We don't have any choice.  Captain, glad to have you here. 120.  Dozens. I'd rather not say exactly. But the men trapped underground number almost three thousand.  They've been getting water, food.  They keep it on a truck - it must have a lead-lined roof. They move it constantly.  They've got three of them. The routes don't vary much.  No leads. It's a bluff - Bane wouldn't give control of that bomb to someone else.  Captain, things are more complicated than you think. There's somebody you need to meet. Blake?  Where the hell are they? It's not like we have a lot of time, here.  The bomb goes off tomorrow. We've got about eighteen hours to do something.  We mark that truck. Get a GPS on it, then we can start thinking about how to take it down.      Foley. Where's Foley, dammit?! 130.  You're sending your wife to the door when the city's under occupation?!  What did you do, bury your uniform in the backyard?  You forgotten all the years we went out on patrol with every gangbanger wanting to plant one as soon as our backs were turned?  Deal?! Bane's got their balls in a vice. That's not a deal -  You think he's given control of that bomb to one of 'the people'?! You think this is part of some revolution? There's one man with his finger on the button - Bane.  This only gets fixed from inside the city, Foley.  Look, I'm not asking you to walk down Grand in your dress blues. But we've got to do something before this maniac blows us all to hell.  Keep your head down? What's that gonna do tomorrow, when that thing blows?  Miss Tate, I can't ask you -  Bruce Wayne built it. 132.  Let's go.  Stay further up the block. (Points at Men.) They're gonna cross the street and try and slow the truck down. As it approaches, hit this button. If the needle hits two hundred - give me the signal and I mark the truck. Okay?  Got it.  On whose authority?  No lawyer, no witnesses. What sort of due process is this?  Crane, if you think we are going willingly out onto that ice, you've got another think coming.  Looks that way.  When what starts?  Come on, come on...  That's impossible... Come on! Cut over to Fifth!  Give me a hand! Let's get a cable on it and drag it out! Come on, we're almost there -  What're you doing?  So this is the part where you vanish, only this time you don't come back?  I never cared who you were -  But shouldn't the people know the hero who saved them?  Bruce Wayne?  'I see a beautiful city and a brilliant people rising from this abyss...'  'I see the lives for which I lay down my life, peaceful, useful, prosperous and happy...'  'I see that I hold a sanctuary in their hearts, and in the hearts of their descendants, generations hence. It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done...' 'It is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known.'  Can I change your mind about quitting the force?  They know.  It was Batman. 160.
dialogues.Daggett: Everyone knows Wayne's holed up in there with eight-inch nails, peeing into Mason jars.  Good of you to let me on the grounds.  Why waste your time talking to the man who threw away your investment on some save-the-world vanity project? He can't help you get your money back. But I can.            After eight years he has to pick tonight...     What about the men they arrested?          And can we get some girls in here?  You dumb bitch.  Dumb to show up here tonight.  'I want' never gets...  Where's what?  Oh, yeah - the ultimate tool for a master thief with a record. I don't have it.  The 'Clean Slate'? Type in a name and date of birth and within a couple hours that person ceases to exist in any database? Little too good to be true.  That's why I bought them. But they had nothing. It was a gangland myth.  I'd like to point out that we have a non-board member here. Highly irregular, even if it is his family name above the door...  Into the ground, sir. Anybody disagree? Check the value of your shares this morning. Gambling on crazy futures didn't just lose Mr. Wayne his seat, it's lost us all a lot of money. He needs to leave.  Let's get down to business.     How the hell did Miranda Tate get the inside track on the Wayne board?! Was she meeting with Wayne? Was she sleeping with Wayne?  Clearly you don't 'know of' anything, do you?! Where's Bane?!  Then where is the masked -  What the hell's going on?  You see me running Wayne Enterprises?! Your stock exchange hit didn't work, friend. And now you've got my construction crews working all hours around the city? How's that supposed to help my company absorb Wayne's?  You stay right there! I'm in charge!  I've paid you a small fortune -  What is this?  What are you?  You are true evil...
dialogues.Selina: I like having someone around to open doors for me.  Right hand. No partials. 23.  Not so fast, handsome. You got something for me?  I don't know what you're going to do with Mr. Wayne's prints...but I'm guessing you'll need his thumb.  You don't count so good, huh?  Okay, okay -  My friend is waiting outside. Just hit 'send'... 24.   It'll liven up in a minute, trust me.  Great. Catch you later.  It would've been a lot easier to just give me what we agreed.  No. But my friend over there...?  Every cop in the city's missing him.  I don't know... You did just use his cell phone. 25.  Keep some pressure on that, sweetheart.  There's a man in there - he's bleeding!        Get out.  Now.  I told you not to try it with the assholes, Jen.  Okay, the assholes who hit.  Probably the watch.       You were supposed to be a shut-in.  Why didn't you call the police?  Yeah? Who are you pretending to be?  His wife's in Ibiza. She left her diamonds behind, though. Worried they'd get stolen. 43.    Don't condescend, Mr. Wayne. You don't know a thing about me.  You don't get to judge me because you were born in the master bedroom of Wayne Manor.  I started off doing what I had to. Once you've done what you had to they'll never let you do what you want to.  There's no fresh start in today's world. Any twelve-year-old with a cell phone could find out what you did. Everything we do is collated and quantified. Everything sticks. We are the sum of our mistakes.  The mistakes stick better. Trust me.  I take what I need to from those who have more than enough. I don't stand on the shoulders of people with less.  I'd do more to help someone than most of the people in this room. Than you.  Or maybe you're being unrealistic about what's really in your pants other than your wallet.  You think all this can last?  There's a storm coming, Mr. Wayne. You and your friends better batten down the hatches, because when it hits you're all gonna wonder how you ever thought you could live so large and leave so little to the rest of us.  I'm adaptable.             He's not a mark.  And he doesn't have a cent to his name, anyway.     Yeah, it's not much.  But it's more that you've got right now.        Let's just say that I've incurred the wrath of some people less susceptible to my charms than you.  And how would he do that?  It doesn't exist.  Why?  Tell him I'll think about it.  Mr. Wayne? I'm sorry they took all your money.      Would you mind? 88.  Don't tell me, still in love?  Girl's gonna eat.  Maybe it's not you I'm running from.        I'm not sure.  Why, honey, you wanna hold my hand?  This was someone's home.  No. It's what I thought I wanted.  You boys know you can't come into my neighborhood without asking politely.  Never steal anything from someone you can't outrun, kid.  Just tax.  You came back. I thought they'd killed you.  If you're expecting an apology -  And why would I help you?  You're gonna trust me with that? After what I did to you?  Start fresh? I can't even get off this island.  Why do you need Fox?  Who says it needs saving? Maybe I like it this way.  Get your powerful friend on the case.
dialogues.Miranda: It's important, Mr. Pennyworth.  I could try explaining that a save-the-world project, vain or not, is worth investing in, whatever the return. I could try, Mr. Daggett, but you understand only money and the power you think it buys, so why waste my time, indeed?  Mr. Fox, I believe in what Mr. Wayne was trying to do...  I'm only asking for explanations because I think I can help.  He doesn't talk to you either?      Bruce Wayne at a charity ball?  Even before you became a recluse, you never came to these things...  Actually, this is my party, Mr. Wayne.  And the proceeds will go where they should, because I paid for the big fat spread myself.  You have to invest to restore balance to the world. Take our clean-energy project...  You have a practiced apathy, Mr. Wayne. But a man who doesn't care about the world doesn't spend half his fortune on a plan to save it... And isn't so wounded when it fails that he goes into hiding...  Have a good evening, Mr. Wayne.  You brought me out here to show me a rubbish dump, Mr. Fox?  This is it, isn't it?  Is Bruce Wayne really that paranoid?  No radiation, no fossil fuels. Free, clean energy for an entire city.  You've built a lot of security around a damp squib. About three years ago a Russian scientist published a paper on weaponized fusion reactions. One week later your reactor started developing problems... (Looks at Wayne.) I think this machine works.  Would it make you feel better to know that the Russian scientist died in a plane crash six months ago?  And to do what with it?  And if we can't?  Destroy the world's best chance for a sustainable future?  Bruce, if you want to save the world you have to start trusting it.  Doesn't count. You have no choice.  Nobody's answering.  Do you have keys?  Let's find a window.  Fox worked the board like you've never seen - I'm in, Daggett's out and he's not happy.  Suffering builds character.  I'll take care of your parents' legacy, Bruce.  Who's this?  Where's Alfred?  What's that?  When I was a child we had almost nothing. But on the nights we had a fire, we felt very rich indeed. 82.  Not always. Not when I was young.  An old mistake.  More than a few...  We could leave. Tonight. Take my plane. Go anywhere we wanted.  Bruce got a lot of things right. Keeping the board in the dark wasn't one of them...  Alright, stop. 96.  Lucius, you'll kill this man and yourself, and barely slow them down.  And as CEO of Wayne Enterprises, I have to take responsibility for it.  Because, Captain, we built it.  I hear you're looking for men, Commissioner.  How about me, instead?  My company built it.  And he wanted to destroy it. It was me who didn't listen. Please.  Bruce?  Do what's necessary.  I know.  But he is not the child of R¯'s al  I am. And though I am not 'ordinary', I am a citizen...  My mother named me Talia before she was killed. The way I would've been killed if not for my protector...Bane.

description: Despite his tarnished reputation after the events of The Dark Knight (2008), in which he took the rap for Dent's crimes, Batman feels compelled to intervene to assist the city and its Police force, which is struggling to cope with Bane's plans to destroy the city.—WellardRockard
name: The Dark Knight Rises
